project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Performance by Ronald Odrich on clarinets with Robert Roberts on guitar, John Woodfield on bass, and Jerry Coleman on drums. Jazz performance including tunes, "Blues in F," "Here's that Rainy Day Again," "Meditation," "Sweet Georgia Brown," and "Lying for Lions"
2. Jazz concert continued with lecture on how to play and learn jazz. Tunes include "Spring is Here," "When Sonny gets Blue," "Bye bye Blackbird," and "There is no Greater Love"

item.title: Ronald Odrich Master Class 1982-07-02 Pick-Staiger Concert Hall

item.terms_of_use: The audio recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited.

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Blind mock auditions with Marcellus, Brody, and Smith with excerpts from Ravel's "Bolero," Beethoven's "Symphony No. 6," Kodaly's "Dances of Galanta," and Mendelssohn's "Scherzo to a Midsummer Night's Dream" followed by discussion on auditions with Marcellus, Brody, and Smith
2. Continued audition discussion
3. Continued audition discussion
4. Debussy "Premiere Rhapsodie" - Paul Garment
5. Concert-lecture with Ronald Odrich on jazz improvisation with tunes including "Days of Wine and Roses" and "There'll Never Be Another You
6. Concert-lecture with Ronald Odrich (continued) with tunes including "Meditation" with Paul Garment
7. Concert-lecture with Ronald Odrich (continued) playing a recording of Eddie Daniel's rendition of C.P.E. Bach's "Solfegietto" and then performing "Spring is Here"
8. Concert-lecture with Ron Odrich (continued) with tunes including "Morning of a Carnival Black Orpheus" and "Too Late Now" and "Blues in the Closet" with Paul Garment

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Blind mock auditions with comments from Robert Marcellus, Clark Brody, and Gregory Smith and excerpts from Beethoven "Symphony No. 6," Mendelssohn "Scherzo to 'A Midsummer Night's Dream,'" Rimsky-Korsakov "Capriccio Espagnol," Schubert "Symphony No. 8 'Unfinished,'" and Kodaly "Dances of Galanta"
2. Copland "Concerto for Clarinet" - Hannah Ink
3. Concert-lecture with Ronald Odrich including performances of Benedetto Marcello's "Oboe Concerto" Adagio arranged for clarinet performed once without and once with jazz improvisation, and tunes including "Wine and Roses," There'll Never be Another You," and "Meditation"
4 Concert-lecture by Ronald Odrich continues with tunes "I"ll Remember April," "Who Can I Turn To?" "Morning in the Park," and "Blues in B-flat

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Continuation of masterclass with Diane Cawein; Concert with Ronald Odrich: works performed include an arrangement of Benedetto Marcello's "Oboe Concerto" followed by an improvisation on the Concerto's Adagio and select jazz tunes including "Wine and Roses"
2. Lecture on playing jazz by Ronald Odrich with jazz tunes "There'll Never Be Another You" and "It Might as Well Be Spring"
3. Continuation of concert with Ronald Odrich and select jazz tunes including "Meditation," "Spring is Here," "Whom Can I Turn To?" and "Blues in the Closet"

4. More question and answer Session

item.title: Clarinet Master Class 1984-06-26

collection.description: Robert Marcellus Master Class Audio Archives
collection.title: Robert Marcellus Master Class Audio Archives

item.terms_of_use: The audio recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited.

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Lecture by Marcellus and listening of numerous orchestral clarinet solo recordings: 1926 Philidelphia Orchestra, Liszt "Hungarian Rhapsody," and Ippolitov-Ivanov "Caucasian Sketches (March of the Sardar)" both under Stowkowski; 1933 Vienna Philharmonic, Beethoven "Symphony No. 6 (mvt 4)" and "Symphony No. 4 (mvt 2)" under Bruno Walter; 1939 Cleveland Orchestra, Shostakovitch "Symphony No. 1 (mvt 1)" and Rimsky Korsakov "Scheherazade (mvts 2, 3, and 4)" under Rodzinski; 1939 Chicago Symphony, Brahms "Symphony No. 3 (mvt 2)" under Frederic Stock; 1935 New York Philharmonic, Mendelssohn "Scherzo to a Midsummer Night's Dream," 1939/40 New York Philharmonic, Herold "Zampa Overture" and Rossini "Semiramide" all under Toscanini; 1936 Philidelphia Orchestra, Borodin "Polovtsian Dances" under Stokowski; unknown date (possibly 1936) Philidelphia Orchestra, Chopin transcroption by Stokowski "Mazurka in A minor" under Stokowski.
2. 1939/40 CBS Symphony, Deems Taylor "Through the Looking Glass" under Howard Barlow; unknown year Cleveland Orchestra, Prokofiev "Peter and the Wolf" (clarinet solo played by McGinnis?) unknown conductor; 1939 Minneapolis Symphony, Ravel "Tombeau de Couperin" under Demit Metropolis; 1946 Philidelphia Orchestra Myaskovsky "Symphony No. 21" unknown conductor; Brahms "Symphony No. 3 (mvt 2)" and Beethoven "Symphony No. 6 (mvt 1)"; CBS Symphony, Offenbach "Orpheus in the Underworld Overture" under Ruchinsky; Chicago Symphony, Rimsky-Korsakov "Scheherazade (mvt 2,3,4)," Strauss "Don Quixote," and Bartok "Hungarian Sketches" all under Fritz Reiner. Session concludes with quotes from conductor Eugene Ormandy.

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
Lecture recital on antique clarinets by Bill McColl, assisted by Larry McDonald on clarinet and Chris Serverin on piano
1. Rudolf Jettel's "Klarifari," Adolphe Adam's solo from "Le postillion de Lonjumeau," Luigi Bassi's "Rigoletto Fantasia," Verdi's solo from "La Forza del Destino," Mozart's "Concerto in A" mvt 3, Weber's "Concertino"
2. Rossini's "Barber of Seville," Schubert's "Symphony No. 8 'Unfinished'", Devienne's "Duo" (with Larry McDonald), Wagner's "Tristan und Isolde" (bass clarinet), Berlioz's "Symphonie Fantastique" (e-flat clarinet), select authentic English country songs including "The Ploughboy," "The Stool of Repentance," and "Off to California," select authentic American tunes including "Washington's March," "Tirolese Song of Liberty," and "The Bugle Quick-step," a duet by Telemann for two tenor chalumeaux (with Larry McDonald), and a transcription of "Skaros" by Petroloukas Halkias

project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Debussy "Premiere Rhapsodie" - Bob Walzel
2. Debussy "Premiere Rhapsodie" - Bob Walzel (continued)
3. Mock auditions with comments from Robert Marcellus, Gregory Smith, and Clark Brody. Excerpts include Beethoven's "Symphony No. 6," Mendelssohn's "Scherzo to 'A Midsummer Night's Dream,'" Liszt's "Hungarian Rhapsody," and Mussorgsky's "Night on a Bald Mountain"
4. Mock auditions (continued)

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Lecture of fundamentals: Air speed and wind, embouchure and voicing, breathing, and finger/hand position. (Break 19:22-23:17) More lecture on sequencing of studies and repertoire in teaching. Rose "40 Studies": #13 - Harlow Hopkins
2. Stravinsky "Three Pieces for Clarinet Solo" - Lola Markworth (continued)
3. Rose "40 Studies": #21-Mike Limoli (part 2); #11 - Don Story; Cavallini "Caprices": #13 - Don Story; Stravinsky "Three Pieces for Clarinet Solo": Lola Markworth
4. Rose "40 Studies": #13-Harlow Hopkins (part 2); #21-Mike Limoli

item.terms_of_use: The audio recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited.

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Rimsky-Korsakov "Capriccio Espagnol," Lalo "Le Roi d'Ys," and Brahms "Symphony No. 4" - Elizabeth Sandusky; Rimsky-Korsakov "Scheherazade" and Strauss "Til Eulenspiegel" - Sharon Busby; Rachmaninoff "Symphony No. 2" and Prokofiev "Peter and the Wolf" - Pamela Helton
2. Schubert "Der Hirt auf dem Felsen" (Susan Brummell, soprano) - Steve Roberts; Debussy "Premiere Rhapsodie" - Alan Talycenas
3. A chamber music and collaborative pianist lecture by Christopher Severin on Beethoven's "Trio" for cello, clarinet and piano, Schubert's "Der Hirt auf dem Felsen," Bartok's "Contrasts," Mozart's "Concerto in A," and Brahms' "Sonata No. 2 in Eb Major"
4. Lecture by Christopher Severin continued: Brahms' "Sonata No. 2 in Eb Major," Copland's "Clarinet Concerto," and Berg's "Four Pieces for Clarinet and Piano"

2. Herold "Zampa Overture," Rachmaninoff "Symphony No. 3," and Mozart "Concerto in A" mvt 1 - Scott McAllister

project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Lecture by Christopher Severin on Schumann "Fantasy Pieces" and Brahms "Sonata No. 1 in F minor" and "Sonata No. 2 in E-flat major"
2. Lecture by Christopher Severin (continued) on Brahms "Sonata No. 1 in F minor" and "Sonata No. 2 in E-flat major"; Debussy "Premiere Rhapsodie"; Berg "Four Pieces for Clarinet and Piano"; Mozart "Concerto in A"
3. Continuation of Severin lecture, Q&A on Mozart and Weber repertoire
4. Continuation of Severin lecture, Q&A on Mozart and Weber repertoire

item.title: Clarinet Master Class 1981-07-06

collection.description: Robert Marcellus Master Class Audio Archives
collection.title: Robert Marcellus Master Class Audio Archives

item.terms_of_use: The audio recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited.

project.desc: Digitization of open reel audio tapes from Music Library
project.name: Robert Marcellus Master Classes

description.item:
1. Lecture on the role of the collaborative pianist in clarinet repertoire by Christopher Severin, discusses Schumann "Piano Concerto" and Brahms "Sonata No. 2 in E-flat major"
2. Schubert "Der Hirt auf dem Felsen" (Lynda Kemeny, soprano) - Sharon Busby; Brahms "Sonata No. 2 in E-flat major" mvt 1 - Carmen Bacon
3. Brahms "Sonata No. 2 in E-flat major" - Carmen Bacon (continued)

item.title: Clarinet Master Class 1983-06-28 / 1983-06-29
